intro: Allionia linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf allionia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Allionia linearis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
